description.narrative: The Commonwealth of Learning (COL) is a small intergovernmental organisation created by the Commonwealth Heads of Government to encourage the development and sharing of open learning/distance education knowledge, resources and technologies. The two focus areas of COL are education and livelihoods. COL is helping developing nations improve access to quality education and training enabling them to benefit from improved livelihoods, greater gender equity, and overall economic, social and cultural development. It is hosted by the Government of Canada and headquartered in Vancouver Canada. Through the Australian aid program, Australia is providing a voluntary core contribution to COL of $1.0 million to be expensed during the 2014-15 financial year.
